intro: Kadua cordata var. nitens, commonly known as the silverleaf kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. This species is often found in wet forest environments and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii.
